instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.EDP_BKLT_EN: What is EDP_BKLT_EN? This is an enable signal. Anytime you see “_EN”, it means when the voltage is high(3.3 volts), whatever it is going to is being turned on or enabled. Here, “EDP_BKLT” which stands for “embedded displayport backlight” is being enabled. This signal usually goes to an LED driver used for creating a power rail for the LCD screen backlight, to tell it to turn on & create this rail. .
definitions.D7701: What is D7701? diode in the backlight circuit sitting between the BKL_SW pin of the LED driver and backlight output. Very common for via between this and BKL_FB for feedback to blow, causing no boost. Measure continuity between pin 2 of this diode and feedback pin of LED driver if backlight output is PPBUS_G3H with no boost.
definitions.BKL_EN: What is BKL_EN? BKL_EN enables backlight. Anytime you see a signal ending with “_EN” , that means this signal being present/high enables what it is referring to. This signal says “BKL” before “_EN”. “BKL” sounds short for “BACKLIGHT”, so it is safe to assume this signal enables backlight when present. .
definitions.BKL_PWM: What is BKL_PWM? BKL_PWM sets the brightness of the screen. The system will send a PWM signal to BKL_PWM pin to set brightness. If this is low, backlight voltage will boost higher than PPBUS_G3H input, but not enough to make the screen light properly..
definitions.EDP_BKLT_PWM: What is EDP_BKLT_PWM? EDP_BKLT_PWM sets the brightness of the screen. The system will send a PWM signal to BKL_PWM pin to set brightness. If this is low, backlight voltage will boost higher than PPBUS_G3H input, but not enough to make the screen light properly..
definitions.LP8550: What is LP8550? This is an LED driver responsible for creating the backlight on the LCD screen of Macbooks from 2011 through 2015.

threads.title: No backlight <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Board boots to desktop.
I can see the log in screen but there is no backlight.

F7700 fuse good,
<SIGNAL>PPVIN_S0SW_LCDBKLT_FET</SIGNAL>=0v

<SIGNAL>EDP_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL>=0
<SIGNAL>BKLT_PLT_RST_L</SIGNAL>=3.3v

No short on <TRANSISTOR>Q7707</TRANSISTOR> PIN 5

LED driver?

threads.title: No backlight <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Try 2-3 times PRAM reset.
Also try starting in SMC bypass mode.

Did you try known good LCD assembly?

Also see what happens if tie together pins3/4 of <TRANSISTOR>Q7707</TRANSISTOR>.

threads.title: No backlight <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Try 2-3 times PRAM reset --> no change when I did this
Also try starting in SMC bypass mode ---> no change when I did this

Anything to check on [SIZE=4]<SIGNAL>EDP_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> missing[/SIZE]

Tied together pins3/4 of <TRANSISTOR>Q7707</TRANSISTOR> ---> still no backlight

threads.title: No backlight <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
"Tied together pins3/4 of <TRANSISTOR>Q7707</TRANSISTOR> ---> still no backlight"
Do you get voltage at L7701 then?

threads.title: No backlight <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
No backlight <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Keep the pins tied together.
Inspect XW7720 integrity.
Post diode mode around <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>; especially at return resistors and <DIODE>D7701</DIODE> pins.

threads.title: No backlight <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
[ATTACH type="full" alt="Webp.net-resizeimage.jpg"]59656[/ATTACH]

[ATTACH type="full" alt="Webp.net-resizeimage(1).jpg"]59657[/ATTACH]
XW7720, I have never worked on this switch trace before. I don't know what I am looking for in terms of integrity.

<DIODE>D7701</DIODE>
Diode to ground
1: 0.45V
2: 0.65V

<RESISTOR>R7717</RESISTOR>-<RESISTOR>R7722</RESISTOR>: 0.64 V Diode mode to ground on all pins


I saw this image: do I just scrape at the circular area and run a wire as below:
[ATTACH type="full" alt="TRACE.jpg"]59658[/ATTACH]

So I scraped away the area and bridged with solder.There is continuity with the diode.

[ATTACH type="full"]59659[/ATTACH]

Post <SIGNAL>BKL_EN</SIGNAL>/PWM.

threads.message:
<SIGNAL>BKL_EN</SIGNAL>= 2.83V
<SIGNAL>BKL_PWM</SIGNAL> = 0.0V

threads.title: No backlight <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Remove <RESISTOR>R7704</RESISTOR> and tie together <SIGNAL>BKL_EN</SIGNAL>/PWM.

threads.title: No backlight <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Will do, can you tell me what you are considering?

I was thinking:

1) high resistance at <RESISTOR>R7704</RESISTOR> (damaged resistor?)
2) Short at <CAPACITOR>C7704</CAPACITOR> ---> will need to check diode to ground
3) Short somewhere on <SIGNAL>EDP_BKLT_PWM</SIGNAL> ---> will need to check diode to ground
4) Internal issue on <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>

threads.title: No backlight <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>EDP_BKLT_PWM</SIGNAL> comes from PCH.
Forcing <SIGNAL>BKL_PWM</SIGNAL> to 3V can help in diagnose process.

threads.title: No backlight <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
OK done:

[ATTACH type="full" alt="Webp.net-resizeimage(3).jpg"]59661[/ATTACH]
NOW:
<SIGNAL>BKL_EN</SIGNAL>= 2.83V
<SIGNAL>BKL_PWM</SIGNAL> = 2.83V

No backlight.
I can still see the image of an apple logo but it is now boot looping and not getting to the desktop like before.
But, no backlight.

...? <CHIP>LP8550</CHIP>

threads.title: No backlight <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
"Did you try known good LCD assembly?"
???

Change <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>.
Once removed, check continuity from A5 ball (FB) to K/<DIODE>D7701</DIODE>.

threads.title: No backlight <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
replaced <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>
It worked informaticos!!!! Display now works!

Should I remove all jumpers and put back resistors?
booting to desktop
No boot looping.

threads.title: No backlight <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Yes, rebuild original traces.
